Components¶

trisigma.toolkit¶

class src.toolkit.Alarm(broker, interval, delta=None)¶

This is a class that can be used to trigger functions in different intervals.

__call__()¶

Will return true if the current interval has ended.

__init__(broker, interval, delta=None)¶

Constructor method

Parameters

  • broker (trisigma.Broker) – Broker object

  • interval (string) – The interval in which the target function should be triggered. Units: (seconds: s, minutes: m, days: d, weeks: w, years: y.

  • delta (datetime.Timedelta) – Amount of delay to add on each interval. eg. interval of “1w” with delta=timedelta(days=3) would mean “every Wednesday”.

static(interval, _id, delta=None)¶

Alternative constructor that will keep track of the interval staticly.

Parameters

  • broker (trisigma.Broker) – Broker object

  • interval (string) – The interval in which the target function should be triggered. Units: (seconds: s, minutes: m, days: d, weeks: w, years: y.

  • _id (string) – identifier for the alarm. If an id for the alarm already exist, then that alarm will be returned.

  • delta (datetime.Timedelta) – Amount of delay to add on each interval. eg. interval of “1w” with delta=timedelta(days=3) would mean “every Wednesday”.


class src.toolkit.Trail(broker, perc, save=False)¶

This class can be used to create trailling loss orders

__call__()¶

This object must be called in order to update the trail based on the new price

__init__(broker, perc, save=False)¶

Constructor for Trail object

Parameters

  • broker (trisigma.Broker) – broker object

  • perc (int) – The trailling percentage (0.0-1.0)

  • save (bool) – Whether to save the trail in a list for plotting:

activate()¶

Activates the trail. When activated, trigger functions like on_hit() will be usable.

deactivate()¶

Deactivates the trail. When deactivated, trigger functions like on_hit will always return False.

is_active()¶

Returns true of trail is active

lock(value=None)¶

When locked, trail will remain the same even if price changes.

Parameters

value (float) – lockes the trail at a specific value.

on_change(_dir)¶

Returns True if trails last movement is in the same direction as <dir>

Parameters

dir (string) – “higher”, or “lower”,

on_hit()¶

Returns true if the price hit the trail

reset(target_price=None)¶

Resets the trail to the current price * perc

Parameters

target_price (float) – resets to target_price*perc instead of current_price*perc

unlock()¶

When unlocked, trail will be reset to its original value. Trail value will change as price goes beyond the percentage.


class src.toolkit.Traces(broker)¶

This class can be used to set regions defined by traces

__call__()¶

Calling this magic method will update the region of the current price based on the traces.

__init__(broker)¶

Constructor for Traces object

get_region()¶

Returns the region that the price is at

get_traces()¶

Returns traces

here_since(region, duration)¶

Returns true if price been in the given reagon for a specified amount of time

Parameters

  • region (int) – The region of the price

  • duration (int) – How long, in seconds, is the price expected to be in this region?

is_inside(region, ohlc)¶

Checks wether if the price was inside the given region within the given candlesticks

Parameters

  • region (int) – Region to check

  • ohlc (dict[]) – Candlesticks as a list of dict

set_traces(new_traces, save=None)¶

Set new traces

Parameters

new_traces (dict) – new traces as dict, key is the name value is the price point


class src.toolkit.Sock¶
add(func, re=False)¶

Adds a new function with a target query. Whenever the listener receives a new message that matches the query, it will call the given function.

Parameters

  • query (string) – The message that will trigger the function.

  • func (function) – The function that should be called whenever the proper message is received.

  • re (bool) – Enables regex search the query

send(timeout=5.0, port=None)¶

Sends a message in the socket

Parameters

  • msg (string) – Content of the message

  • timeout (float) – timeout (default: 5.0)

  • port (int) – the port to send a message from (default: 3003, this is the port that is used by the listener).

trisigma.time_utils¶

src.time_utils.ceil(date, interval, delta=None)¶
Makes a ceil rounding to the given date.
eg. date = <2022-10-28:23-53-13>, interval = “15m” –> <2022-10-29:00-00-00>

date = <2022-10-28:23-53-13>, interval = “2d” –> <2022-10-30:00-00-00>

Parameters

  • date (<datetime.datetime> or <int> (as a timestamp)) – the date that will be rounded.

  • interval (<str>) – the interval that will be used to round the date.

  • delta (<datetime.timedelta>) – (Optional) adds offset to the rounding. eg: interval=”1w”, delta=timedelta(days=2) will round to the next Wednesday, instead of Monday.

src.time_utils.floor(date, interval, delta=None)¶
Makes a floor rounding to the given date.
eg. date = <2022-10-28:23-53-13>, interval = “15m” –> <2022-10-28:23-45-00>

date = <2022-10-28:23-53-13>, interval = “1d” –> <2022-10-28:00-00-00>

Parameters

  • date (<datetime.datetime> or <int> (as a timestamp)) – the date that will be rounded.

  • interval (<str>) – the interval that will be used to round the date.

  • delta (<datetime.timedelta>) – (Optional) adds offset to the rounding. eg: interval=”1w”, delta=timedelta(days=2) will round to the last Wednesday, instead of Monday.

src.time_utils.to_timestamp(rng)¶

Converts a string interval into int seconds, eg. “1m” –> 60, “2d” –> 172800

Parameters

rng (string) – interval

src.time_utils.to_timestamp_split(rng)¶
Converts a string interval into a tuple where the 1st index represents the coefficient, and the 2nd index is the time unit represented in seconds
eg. “1m” –> (1, 60)

“2d” –> (2, 172800)

Parameters

rng (string) – interval

trisigma.scraper¶

class src.scraper.Binance¶
get_klines(lookback, interval)¶

Get the candlesticks of the symbol

Parameters

  • symbol (string) – symbol and quote asset eg. “LINKUSDT”

  • lookback (int) – the number of candles

  • interval – interval for candles

get_price()¶

Get the current price of the symbol

Parameters

symbol (string) – Symbol


class src.scraper.Webull¶
get_klines_min(mins, days)¶

Get the candlestick data at minute interval

Parameters

  • symbols (string[]) – Symbols.

  • mins (int) – Coefficent for minutes. eg, 15 for 15 minutes.

  • days (int) – How many days of data?

get_price()¶

Get the current price of the symbol.

Parameters

symbol (string) – Symbol

trisigma.slack¶

class src.slack.Slack(token, default_channel=None)¶

This class sends messages in a slack channel

__init__(token, default_channel=None)¶

Constructor for Slack object.

Parameters

  • token (string) – slack token

  • default_channel (string) – Sets a default channel. If left blank, then the channel must be specified in every send() function instead.

send(msg, channel=None)¶

Sends a message in a channel

Parameters

  • msg (string) – content of the message

  • channel (string) – Optional only if there is already a default channel specified

trisigma.filemanager¶

class src.filemanager.FileManager(base_path=None)¶
__init__(base_path=None)¶

Constructor for FileManager

Parameters

base_path (string) – Data will be stored in this directory.

load(name, _dir='var')¶

Load a variable in “algdata/data/var” that was previously saved.

Parameters

  • name (string) – name of the json file (without .json extension)

  • _dir (string) – If it needs to be stored in another folder, then the name of the foler should be specified here.

log(name, data)¶

Append a message to a log file. (stored in algdata/logs/)

Parameters

  • name (string) – Name of the log file (without extension)

  • data (string) – The message

save(output, name, _dir='var')¶

Save a variable in “algdata/data/var/” as a json file.

Parameters

  • output (string) – variable that will be saved.

  • name (string) – file name (without extension)

  • _dir (string) – If it needs to be stored in another folder, then the name of the foler should be specified here.
